page.title: 01GOODWORTH CLATFORD/WHERWELL
page.content: This is a naturally beautiful area of undulating chalk countryside,the highest point being 106 feet above sea level.The {LANDSCAPE}is partially covered by natural deciduous woodland in Harewood Forest and partially by cultivated fields. Two pretty{VILLAGES}with thatched cottages,Goodworth Clatford and Wherwell,nestle by the {RIVERS.} Goodworth Clatford lies on the River Anton which flows through a wide valley and is a tributary of the River Test.Wherwell is situated on the flood plain of the Test.Both rivers are famous for trout fishing. The villages are lively expanding communities,served by buses to Andover and Winchester.Both the villages have primary {SCHOOLS},Wherwell school is static in numbers but Clatford C.E.School is expanding.
